subject: Re: Intro
author: Jon
full_text:
Hi Beth,

One of the better groups to join that covers all areas of the prarnomal is United Paranormal on ning.  You might want to check it out.

http://unitedparanormalinternational.ning.com/


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "beth2marilyn@..." <beth2marilyn@...> wrote:
>
> Hello everyone! My name is Beth and I am new to this group! Thank you to the
> owners/moderators who approved my membership! I was looking for a group of
> paranormal investigators who enjoy talking about the paranormal as much as I
> do. My family and friends seem to be sick of me talking about it and
> whenever I mention something that I've captured I get the roll of the eyes.
> Lol! 
> 
> I've always been interested in ghost and ghost hunting. When I was little my
> mother would tell me that she would always hear boxes being thrown around in
> the basement and thought it to be a ghost. She also said that she would hear
> footsteps and feet being dragged across the long plastic runner that we had
> in front of the basement door. She would get up thinking it was one of us
> kids and we would be sound asleep. So, naturally my interest grew. I never
> seen anything unusual but I would always 'feel' something in that house.
> When I got older, married, and had my own kids I lived in a questionable
> house for 11 years. We would hear footsteps in the attic, the kids would
> complain of seeing 'uncle Sam' standing in the bathroom doorway, or a man
> walking through the bedroom. Of course I never believed them. I asked my son
> when he got older and he remembered the man in great detail. Turns out it
> was a man/spirit in period clothing with a long white beard and top hat.
> Hence the 'uncle Sam' character. I have seen a female child apparition
> standing in the doorway to which I had a witness, my sister-in-law who saw
> the same thing at the same time. We thought it was one of our kids and
> quickly counted heads and it wasn't one of our own. The apparition vanished
> and we never saw it again. I have heard music playing in the basement and a
> man coughing when I've been home alone. A roommate of mine had her shirt
> tugged on and she thought it was me but I wasn't home from work yet. She
> locked herself in her room, scared to death until I came home. The stories
> go on and on. 
> 
> I moved from that home and now I am having strange things occur in this
> house. I should note that I am over a thousand miles from my previous 
> haunted' home. I've lived here 4 yrs and one day I seen a little ball of
> light (ORB) shoot out of my bedroom and go into my husband's chair. I have
> seen a few shadows and have felt that creepy feeling where my hair stands on
> end many times. So, I decided to get a digital recorder. Not thinking that I
> would ever capture anything. I also wanted to use it to debunk EVPs and find
> some Scientific explanation for them. I was wrong. I captured my first EVP
> in the master bedroom of my home. It said, "I have no love". Ok, that got my
> attention. I tried to debunk it and could not. I decided to perform many EVP
> sessions in my bedroom and have caught a lot of them. I have asked questions
> and ask to knock for yes to certain questions. By doing so I figured out
> that it was a Hispanic woman who had been murdered. After some research I
> have since found out that yes someone had died in this house. One of the
> previous tenants claimed there was a ghost here and even went so far as to
> get the house cleansed. I must have brought it back by summoning it while
> conducting my EVP sessions. 
> 
> My fascination grew now that I was actually capturing real evidence. I have
> since went on tours of supposedly haunted places such as: Vulture Mine,
> Arizona, The Bird Cage Theatre Tombstone, Arizona, the San Carlos Hotel,
> Phoenix, and Goldfield Ghost Town, Arizona. I am new at this so I haven't
> been on any investigations on a team. I do it alone. The only equipment that
> I've been using is a digital camera and recorder. My main interest is
> capturing something paranormal on film or EVPs. 
> 
> I have recently made a couple of trips to a local cemetery, during the day,
> middle of the afternoon and have caught amazing EVPs. I have captured many
> different voices and personalities. Some nice, some not so nice. Some women,
> men, and children. It amazes me because I cannot debunk them. I know for a
> fact that I'm the only one there so they can't be explained. I know it wasn
> t me who I was hearing, so who is it? I'm not sure if ghosts really exist or
> if they are all residual energy. Since capturing the voices actually
> answering my questions I am leaning toward that they really exist. There's
> just no denying. I now believe that some are residual and some are
> intelligent spirits. I enjoy EVPs because they are much harder to debunk.
> With photographs there is always that 'what if' or well it could be a glare
> or a glitch in the camera. But with EVPs they are unmistakable. 
> 
> I'm looking forward with getting to know everyone and sharing my experiences
>  
> 
> Beth
>
